subject: for Stefan  Re: [EVP-ITC] EVP Maker (allaphone file) Method Test
author: Ron Lederer
full_text:
--0-747580310-1207264163=:79052
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Stefan   I used your file.  I just checked the original you sent and there is a beep in the front which probably gets duplicated in EVP maker.  Need to figure out a way to eliminate.  
   
  One question for you.  Have you found newbees like me can do many sessions without results?  I have done possibly 12 to 15 sessions.  Ziltch!  Nada!  I trust the process but it ain't paying off yet.  Gotta make something happen.  I do appreciate your help.  Ron L     

Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
          Hi Ron,

what file did you use as the sound source for EVPmaker? I hear beeps in
your recording that aren't part of the original allophones file I made.
The recording is also very loud and sounds distorted, and you didn't
seem to have used the internal cue list of the file (if it was the
original SJ-Allophones.wav file).

Stefan

-- 

> To Bruce, Stefan and others using EVPM. I have posted a file of my
> test with EVPM allaphones under ronriko files. I forward this for two
> reasons: the first as a request from Bruce to determine recurring
> words and second because I wanted to have experienced ears hear my
> recording for comments. Regarding the test, this is just 30 secs or so
> of a 7 minute recording. Recorded at 90% using EVPmaker with xcross. I
> was able to hear "art and arthor" a number of times within the 7
> minutes. This is after requesting no names be spoken.

> Regarding my experiences with evpmaker and the allaphone file sent by
> Stefan, I must say my results have been underwhelming. I hear nothing
> but evp gibberish. I ask that anyone with an ear for this to give a
> listen and tell me if you hear anything intelligent. I am in a
> terrible radio zone here in Mexico so I have high hopes on EVP maker
> and the file Stefan provided. Also excited about the fact that so many
> others are getting excellent communications. Thank you to anyone who
> takes the time to listen to and confirm my recordings. I am beginning
> to feel like I am being blocked out like William had thought. Maybe I
> am in a true dead zone, no pun intended, or "they" don't want me in
> the loop for some reason. Ron L



                           

       
---------------------------------
You rock. That's why Blockbuster's offering you one month of Blockbuster Total Access, No Cost.
